newsitem.title: USA: NY precious metals called to open mixed.
newsitem.headline: NY precious metals called to open mixed.

text.p: COMEX and NYMEX precious metals futures were called to open mixed Wednesday, with gold expected to weaken further but the rest of the complex seen little changed.
Higher real U.S. interest rates following the Fed's credit tightening in March, combined with Tuesday's lower-than-expected rise in U.S. March consumer prices are pressuring gold, analysts said.
In addition, with gold prices in Australian dollar and South African rand back down near the year's lows, more producer hedging is seen as possible.
But gold prices in Indian rupees are also back down near the year's lows and the second wedding season lies ahead, which should support physical offtake, analysts added.
COMEX June gold was called unchanged to off $0.20 from Tuesday's close of $344.10 an ounce after trading from $344.20 to $344.10 on ACCESS.
In the bullion market, spot gold was quoted early at $340.50/$341.00 against the London morning fix of $341.45 and the New York close Tuesday of $341.70/$342.20.
COMEX gold stocks were unchanged Tuesday at 1,032,382 ounces.
COMEX silver stocks fell 37 ounces to 190,537,272 ounces Tuesday.
COMEX May silver was called unchanged to up 0.2 cent from the previous close of $4.710 after trading from $4.71 to $4.72 on ACCESS.
NYMEX July platinum and NYMEX June palladium were called little changed from their Tuesday closes of $367.50 and $150.10, respectively.
